tournament.name: Grand Open Qualifier Bologna 2024 - Legacy European Tour

decks.notes: This deck focuses on leveraging the power of Indomitable Creativity to cheat out powerful creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker. The goal is to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Persist while setting up for explosive plays. The deck also includes a variety of removal spells like Fatal Push and Lightning Bolt to control the board. With a mix of card advantage, disruption, and powerful combo pieces, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents with its creativity and unique synergies.

The main focus of this deck is to efficiently ramp up mana and combo off with Primeval Titan to search for key lands such as Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle and The One Ring. The combination of Amulet of Vigor and bounce lands like Simic Growth Chamber allow for explosive turns and generate massive amounts of mana. The deck aims to quickly assemble the pieces needed to overwhelm the opponent with powerful land synergies and win the game in a single turn.

This deck focuses on controlling the game by using powerful spells and abilities to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The key card in the deck is The One Ring, which can provide a strong advantage when used effectively. The deck also includes a variety of removal spells, counterspells, and card draw options to ensure that the player can maintain control throughout the game. Additionally, the deck includes a companion, Kaheera, the Orphanguard, which provides additional support and synergy with the rest of the cards in the deck.

The main concept of this deck revolves around quickly dealing damage to the opponent using low-cost spells and aggressive creatures, while also utilizing cards like Underworld Breach and Mishra's Bauble for card advantage and recursion. The inclusion of Jegantha as a companion provides additional value and flexibility to the deck, allowing for a consistent mana base and access to a powerful ability. Overall, this deck aims to apply constant pressure and disrupt opponents quickly in order to secure a victory.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler and Wrenn and Six. The deck also includes powerful creatures like Omnath, Locus of Creation and Solitude to dominate the board. The inclusion of Leyline Binding and Boseiju, Who Endures helps to protect key spells and ensure maximum efficiency. The deck aims to maintain control of the game until it can establish a dominant board presence and secure victory through attrition.

The deck focuses on quickly deploying aggressive creatures and using Tribal Flames to deal massive amounts of damage to the opponent. The inclusion of Leyline cards helps to control the opponent's strategies while Leyline Binding can lock down key threats. The mana base is diverse in order to support the multicolored spells in the deck. Jegantha, the Wellspring acts as a companion to provide additional value and flexibility. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast, efficient creatures and burn spells to secure a quick victory.

This deck focuses on utilizing low-cost aggressive creatures and burn spells to deal damage quickly to the opponent. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion allows for extra flexibility and consistency in mana production. The deck also includes cards like Dragon's Rage Channeler and Monastery Swiftspear to apply pressure early in the game, while spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Dart provide direct damage to the opponent or their creatures. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with fast, efficient threats while maintaining the ability to control the board with burn spells.

This deck revolves around utilizing The One Ring as a powerful control tool to manipulate the game in your favor. The deck focuses on control elements such as counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage engines like Narset, Teferi, and Day's Undoing. Leyline Binding and Lórien Revealed help to lock down opponent's threats, while Prismatic Ending provides versatile removal. The deck aims to control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan, ultimately leading to victory through resource management and strategic plays.

This deck focuses on aggressive creature plays to deal quick damage to the opponent. By utilizing a wide range of low-cost creatures and powerful combat spells, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent before they can establish a strong defense. The inclusion of the companion Jegantha, the Wellspring adds an extra layer of versatility to the deck. With a mix of efficient creatures, burn spells, and landfall effects, this deck is designed to be fast-paced and relentless in its assault on the opponent.

This deck revolves around assembling a toolbox of creatures that can be efficiently searched for using cards like Chord of Calling. The key strategy involves utilizing Yawgmoth, Thran Physician to sacrifice creatures for value, while also creating a loop with creatures like Young Wolf and Grist, the Hunger Tide for incremental advantage. The deck also includes various utility creatures like Wall of Roots and Hapatra, Vizier of Poisons, as well as combo pieces like Blood Artist for potential finishers. Overall, the deck aims to create a versatile and resilient board state through creature interaction and combo potential.

This deck focuses on using a variety of creatures to create a toolbox of options for different situations. It utilizes combo interactions between cards like Yawgmoth, Thran Physician and Young Wolf, along with Grist, the Hunger Tide and Chord of Calling to find key pieces. The inclusion of Blood Artist and other utility creatures like Scavenging Ooze and Wall of Roots provide additional support and versatility. The deck also includes lands like Boseiju, Who Endures and Misty Rainforest to help ensure the right mana is available for key plays.

The deck focuses on utilizing low-cost spells and creatures to quickly deal damage to the opponent. It includes a variety of burn spells, as well as creatures with prowess abilities to enhance their power when spells are cast. The addition of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion adds an extra element of versatility. The mana base is optimized for consistency and speed. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy.

This deck revolves around quickly getting powerful creatures onto the battlefield by using cards like Goryo's Vengeance and Ephemerate to cheat them into play from the graveyard. The combination of Satoru, the Infiltrator and Fallaji Archaeologist allows for instant reanimation of creatures, while cards like Solitude and Grief provide disruption and removal to control the board. The deck aims to assemble its combo pieces quickly and efficiently to overwhelm the opponent and win the game with big threats like Atraxa, Grand Unifier and Griselbrand.

This deck focuses on aggressive plays with a combination of efficient creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Tarmogoyf, backed up by disruption in the form of spells like Fatal Push and Thoughtseize. Urza's Saga provides additional value by tutoring for key artifacts, while Wrenn and Six help with card advantage and board control. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion adds consistency and resilience to the deck, allowing for a streamlined game plan of early aggression and disruption to overwhelm opponents in Modern 1 vs 1 gameplay.

This deck focuses on quickly playing a large number of artifact creatures and using cards like Springleaf Drum and Thoughtcast to generate card advantage. Emry, Lurker of the Loch helps to recur artifacts from the graveyard while Sojourner's Companion and Thought Monitor provide additional value. Urza's Saga helps to find key pieces like Myr Enforcer and Frogmite, while Darksteel Citadel and Silverbluff Bridge ensure a consistent mana base. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and efficient affinity strategy.

The deck focuses on using aggressive creatures like Death's Shadow and Murktide Regent to quickly chip away at the opponent's life total while using disruptive spells like Counterspell and Thoughtseize to control the game. The inclusion of cards like Fatal Push and Dismember help to deal with opposing threats, while Stubborn Denial provides protection for your own creatures. The deck also utilizes cards like Dress Down and Sheoldred's Edict to control the opponent's board. Overall, the deck aims to win the game through a combination of aggressive creatures and disruption.

This deck focuses on maximizing the value of +1/+1 counters through cards like Hardened Scales and Zabaz, the Glimmerwasp. By efficiently growing your creatures like Arcbound Ravager and Walking Ballista, you can overwhelm your opponent with a swarm of powerful creatures. The deck also includes artifacts like The Ozolith and Hangarback Walker to further enhance your board presence. With the ability to quickly build a threatening board state, this deck aims to apply pressure early and close out the game before the opponent can stabilize.

The deck focuses on cycling creatures to the graveyard efficiently, particularly with the help of cards like Street Wraith and Architects of Will. Once there are enough creatures in the graveyard, Living End can be cast to bring them all back onto the battlefield, often overwhelming the opponent with a sudden swarm of creatures. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Force of Negation and Faerie Macabre to control the game until the combo can be executed. The goal is to quickly fill the graveyard and then use Living End to win the game in a single explosive turn.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's hand with cards like Thoughtseize and Grief, while also applying pressure with efficient creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Dauthi Voidwalker. It aims to control the board with removal spells such as Lightning Bolt and Terminate, while using powerful finishers like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse. Additionally, it can disrupt opponent's mana base with Blood Moon and apply additional pressure with Fable of the Mirror-Breaker. The deck aims to quickly close out the game before the opponent can stabilize.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game using cards like Dryad of the Ilysian Grove and Sakura-Tribe Elder to ramp up your mana quickly, while using The One Ring to shut down your opponent's strategies. You can then use Scapeshift to search for Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle and trigger its ability multiple times to deal massive damage to your opponent. Wish allows you to search for specific cards you need in any given situation, adding versatility to your control strategy. Overall, the goal is to disrupt your opponent's plans while setting up a powerful win condition.

This deck revolves around utilizing Underworld Breach to loop through the graveyard and cast multiple spells in a single turn. By combining cards like Mishra's Bauble, Grinding Station, and Emry, Lurker of the Loch, the deck aims to mill through the deck quickly and win the game with a Thassa's Oracle or Jace, Vryn's Prodigy activation. Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer provides early game pressure and card advantage, while Lightning Bolt and Unholy Heat offer removal and protection. Urza's Saga can help find key artifacts like The One Ring, further fueling the combo potential.

This Modern 1 vs 1 deck focuses on aggressive play with Death's Shadow as a key card. Utilizing cards like Drown in the Loch, Fatal Push, and Thoughtseize, the deck aims to control the board while quickly bringing out powerful threats such as Murktide Regent and Orcish Bowmasters. With a mix of disruption, removal, and efficient creatures, the deck looks to apply pressure early and maintain control throughout the game. The mana base includes various fetch lands and dual lands to ensure consistency and flexibility in casting spells.

The deck aims to quickly fill the graveyard with creatures and then cast Living End to bring them all back onto the battlefield, overwhelming the opponent with powerful creatures. It utilizes cards like Street Wraith and Grief to discard creatures into the graveyard, while also controlling the board with cards like Force of Negation and Subtlety. The deck focuses on a combo strategy of setting up the graveyard and then using Living End as a game-winning play to swing the match in its favor.

This Merfolk deck focuses on quickly building a board presence with lord effects to boost each other. It includes synergy with tribal synergies like Vodalian Hexcatcher and Cenote Scout, along with disruption tools like Merfolk Trickster and Subtlety. Aether Vial helps cheat creatures into play while Cavern of Souls ensures spells can't be countered. The deck also includes some control elements with Force of Negation and Dismember. The land base includes utility lands like Mutavault and an Aggro strategy is supplemented by tempo plays like Three Steps Ahead.

This deck focuses on controlling the game by using powerful removal spells and hand disruption to disrupt your opponent's game plan. It also leans heavily on graveyard manipulation and synergy with cards like Cling to Dust and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse to generate value. With additional win conditions in the form of Emrakul, the Promised End and The One Ring, the deck aims to grind out opponents and out value them over the course of the game. Additionally, the deck can lock opponents out of the game with cards like Urborg, Tomb of Yawgmoth and Field of Ruin.
